tweet_text: H.R. 5147, Prohibiting the Secretary of Defense from procuring personal protective equipment from certain non-allied foreign nations, and for other purposes.

name: Rep. Rob Wittman
tweet_text: H.R.4935, SWOLE Act (Amended): Improves the retention of Surface Warfare Officers (SWO) by investigating root causes to female retention shortfalls, and increases the marketability of SWOs by credentialing them as mariners: a win-win for the Navy and the Merchant Marines alike.

name: Rep. Rob Wittman
tweet_text: H.R.4987, The Global Force Management Oversight Act: Requires an annual report on the Global Force Management Allocation Plan (GFMAP) and briefing on major changes to the GFMAP throughout the year. This  makes sure our tax-payer dollars reflect the priorities of the NDS.

name: Rep. Rob Wittman
tweet_text: H.R.4861, The COBIA Act: Ensures schools educating service-connected children receive the full sum of federal impact aid to which they are currently entitled. A big win for school districts near military installations.

name: Rep. Rob Wittman
tweet_text: H.R.5104, The Just In Case Act: Establishes Special Emergency Reimbursement Authority for the Dept of Defense, similar to that provided by Sec. 3610 of the CARES Act, to allow contractors be reimbursed if they are unable to work on-site due to a pandemic.

- Modeled to utilize public/private partnerships
- Features a challenge process to eliminate duplicate efforts
- Technology neutral

tweet_text: We must also prioritize Sealift Recapitalization. The readiness goal is to have an 85% availability rate to support large-scale force deployments. …Our availability rate? 40.7%. How can we expect our soldiers to fight if they cannot get to the fight? #McAleese
